text:
https://datatracker.ietf.org/public/pidtracker.cgi?command=view_id&dTag=7686 
notes that the IESG approved registration of the application/ecmascript and 
related media types. My understanding is that Batik only supports the obsolete 
media type text/ecmascript; it should also support application/ecmascript as 
defined in http://www.ietf.org/internet-drafts/draft-hoehrmann-script-types-
03.txt. Note that application/ecmascript has stricter conformance requirements 
than e.g. text/ecmascript.
creator: batik@bjoernsworld.de
sierkb@gmx.de
text:
See also:
Bug 40299 "ECMAScript and JavaScript media types in mime.types file" with patch:
http://issues.apache.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=40299

creator: cam@apache.org
text: This is now fixed in SVN.
